title: Fiqh of Divorce
body: Hasssan Warsame
Week 3: November 20

title: Introduction
body: • الحمد لله، والصلاة والسلام على رسول الله، وعلى آله وصحبه
• Divorce (*ṭalāq*) is a legislated action in Islam.
• Ends marital bond immediately or after ʿiddah.
• Can occur through words, writing, or gestures.

title: Definition of Ṭalāq
body: • Divorce = dissolution of the marriage bond.
• Types: Immediate (*bā’in*) or eventual (*rajʿī* after ʿiddah).
• Methods: Explicit wording, implicit wording, writing, gestures.
• Judicial rulings or *khulʿ* are also valid.

title: Legitimacy of Divorce
body: • Divorce is permissible based on Qur’an and Sunnah.
• Supported by consensus among scholars.
• Wisdom includes removing harm and resolving disputes.

title: Five Legal Rulings of Divorce
body: 1. Prohibited (حرام): During menstruation or after intercourse.
2. Disliked (Makrūh): When marriage is stable.
3. Obligatory (Wājib): After īlāʾ or court-ordered.
4. Recommended (Mandūb): Due to neglect or hardship.
5. Permissible (Mubāḥ): Incompatibility or bad character.

title: Conditions Related to the Husband
body: • Must be a legal husband.
• Must be adult (bāligh) and sane (‘āqil).
• Must act intentionally and voluntarily.
• Drunken divorce can be valid if intentional.

title: Conditions Related to the Wife
body: • Divorce applies if she is currently married.
• Applies in revocable divorce ʿiddah.
• Not applicable in irrevocable divorce cases.

title: Conditions Related to the Wording
body: • Valid via explicit wording (e.g., 'You are divorced').
• Implicit wording requires intention.
• Writing is valid if intended.

title: Explicit vs Implicit Divorce
body: • Explicit (صريح): Specific words accepted across schools.
• Implicit (كناية): Phrases need intention to count.

title: Cases Where Divorce Does NOT Occur
body: • Mistaken wording or coerced divorce.
• Unconsciousness or severe anger causing loss of awareness.
• No effect from mere intent or thought of divorce.

title: ‘Iddah (Waiting Period) After Divorce
body: • Begins from pronouncement, not court ruling.
• Woman must stay in marital home during ʿiddah.
• Cannot remarry until ʿiddah ends.
• Qur’anic evidence: 'Do not send them out of your homes...' (65:1)

title: Types of ‘Iddah
body: 1. Pregnant: until childbirth (65:4).
2. Non-pregnant, menstruating: three cycles (2:228).
3. Non-menstruating: three lunar months (65:4).

title: Special Cases of Divorce
body: • 'Ṭāliq' alone is invalid unless addressed to wife.
• Intent alone is also invalid.
• No divorce if husband is unaware or coerced.
